thread.title: Senate bill could cut nonviolent drug offenders' sentences
thread.title_full: Senate bill could cut nonviolent drug offenders' sentences

title: Senate bill could cut nonviolent drug offenders' sentences
text: > Political Senate bill could cut nonviolent drug offenders' sentences FILE - In this Jan. 28, 2015 file photo, Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Sen. Charles Grassley, R-Iowa, left, talks with the committee's ranking member Sen. Patrick Leahy, D-Vt. on Capitol Hill in Washington. Nonviolent drug offenders could be eligible for shorter prison sentences under legislation a Senate committee is considering. The Senate Judiciary Committee is expected to approve legislation on Thursday that would give judges discretion to give lesser sentences than federal mandatory minimums in some cases. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh, File)
